children.subject: I don't think you really need either for ML after taking those courses that you've listed; 135 might be helpful to understand the basics of statistics which is the origin of machine learning but even then I wouldn't really recommend taking 135 because I doubt you would benefit much from it. IMO you should just take a course that you think is interesting because it'll be your last semester here.

To be completely honest, I don't think either are very great for ML. Stat 135 is more of an introductory statistics classes that is fundamental for a statistic career, and Stat 150 doesn't feel like it has much to do with ML. In my case, I took 150 after taking 189 and 126, and about half of the class was review from 126, and the other half of the class was stuff (renewal processes, Martingales, Brownian motion) that I don't think overlaps much with generic ML. Maybe you can look into 226a and 123 for a follow-up, as these classes are more for the mathematics behind controls systems.

history.content:
I'm an EECS major who is pretty deep into machine learning and also graduating this semester. I have the option of taking either Stat 135 or Stat 150 but am having a hard time figuring out which one would be better to take for strengthening my background for machine learning. I have taken and done well in EECS 126, STAT 134, CS 189, and CS 285.

Can someone share their experience regarding this issue?
history.subject: Stat 135 or Stat 150?
